    async def _scrape_google_maps(self, city: str, state: str):
        """
        Scrape roofing contractors from Google Maps
        100% free
        """
        
        from playwright.async_api import async_playwright
        
        contractors = []
        
        async with async_playwright() as p:
            browser = await p.chromium.launch(headless=True)
            page = await browser.new_page()
            
            # Search for roofing contractors
            search_url = f"https://www.google.com/maps/search/roofing+contractors+{city}+{state}"
            await page.goto(search_url)
            await page.wait_for_timeout(3000)
            
            # Scroll to load all results
            for _ in range(5):
                await page.evaluate("window.scrollTo(0, document.body.scrollHeight)")
                await page.wait_for_timeout(2000)
            
            # Extract contractor info
            results = await page.evaluate("""
                () => {
                    const contractors = [];
                    const items = document.querySelectorAll('.Nv2PK');
                    
                    items.forEach(item => {
                        const name = item.querySelector('.fontHeadlineSmall')?.textContent;
                        const rating = item.querySelector('.MW4etd')?.textContent;
                        const reviews = item.querySelector('.UY7F9')?.textContent;
                        const phone = item.querySelector('[data-tooltip="Copy phone number"]')?.textContent;
                        const website = item.querySelector('a[data-tooltip="Open website"]')?.href;
                        
                        if (name) {
                            contractors.push({
                                name,
                                rating,
                                reviews,
                                phone,
                                website,
                                source: 'google_maps'
                            });
                        }
                    });
                    
                    return contractors;
                }
            """)
            
            await browser.close()
            
            contractors.extend(results)
        
        return contractors
    
    async def _enrich_contractor(self, contractor: dict):
        """
        Enrich contractor with web intelligence
        """
        
        # Search for company website
        if not contractor.get('website'):
            search_results = await self.web_intel._google_search(
                f'"{contractor["name"]}" {contractor.get("city", "")} website'
            )
            
            if search_results:
                contractor['website'] = search_results[0]['url']
        
        # Scrape website for more info
        if contractor.get('website'):
            try:
                async with AsyncWebCrawler() as crawler:
                    result = await crawler.arun(
                        url=contractor['website'],
                        bypass_cache=True
                    )
                    
                    # Extract with AI
                    from anthropic import Anthropic
                    client = Anthropic(api_key=os.getenv("ANTHROPIC_API_KEY"))
                    
                    message = client.messages.create(
                        model="claude-sonnet-4-20250514",
                        max_tokens=1024,
                        messages=[{
                            "role": "user",
                            "content": f"""
                            Extract contractor information from this website:
                            
                            {result.markdown[:8000]}
                            
                            Provide JSON with:
                            {{
                                "services": [...],
                                "years_in_business": "...",
                                "certifications": [...],
                                "service_areas": [...],
                                "price_range": "...",
                                "specialties": [...],
                                "insurance_info": "...",
                                "warranty_info": "..."
                            }}
                            """
                        }]
                    )
                    
                    import json
                    enrichment = json.loads(message.content[0].text)
                    contractor.update(enrichment)
            
            except:
                pass
        
        # Check permit records to see their work quality
        permits = await self.db.fetch("""
            SELECT COUNT(*) as total_permits,
                   AVG(estimated_value) as avg_job_value
            FROM roofing_permits
            WHERE contractor_name ILIKE $1
        """, f"%{contractor['name']}%")
        
        if permits:
            contractor['total_jobs_found'] = permits[0]['total_permits']
            contractor['avg_job_value'] = permits[0]['avg_job_value']
        
        return contractor

class IncrementalDataUpdater:
    """
    Keep database fresh with daily incremental updates
    Much faster than full scrapes
    """
    
    async def run_daily_updates(self):
        """
        Update only what changed
        """
        
        print("Running incremental updates...")
        
        # 1. New permits (check last 24 hours)
        new_permits = await self._check_new_permits()
        print(f"Found {len(new_permits)} new permits")
        
        for permit in new_permits:
            # For each new permit, check if we have the property
            existing = await self.db.fetchone("""
                SELECT id FROM base_leads 
                WHERE address = $1
            """, permit['address'])
            
            if not existing:
                # New property - full enrichment
                await self.aggregator._enrich_property_completely(
                    permit['address'],
                    permit['city'],
                    permit['state']
                )
            else:
                # Existing property - just update permit history
                await self.db.execute("""
                    UPDATE roofing_leads
                    SET 
                        last_permit_date = $1,
                        total_permits = total_permits + 1,
                        updated_at = NOW()
                    WHERE base_lead_id = $2
                """, permit['issue_date'], existing['id'])
        
        # 2. Price changes (check Zillow/Redfin for updates)
        await self._check_price_changes()
        
        # 3. New listings (properties for sale)
        await self._check_new_listings()
        
        # 4. Weather events (storms, hail)
        await self._check_weather_events()
        
        # 5. News mentions (local news about neighborhoods)
        await self._check_news()
        
        print("âœ… Incremental updates complete")
    
    async def _check_new_permits(self):
        """
        Just check last 24 hours of permits

        """
        from datetime import datetime, timedelta
        
        yesterday = (datetime.now() - timedelta(days=1)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")

        return permits
    
    async def _check_price_changes(self):
        """
        Check if any properties changed price
        Use web scraping + AI
        """
        
        # Get properties that were listed for sale
        listed_properties = await self.db.fetch("""
            SELECT * FROM base_leads
            WHERE listing_status = 'for_sale'
            AND last_price_check < NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
            LIMIT 100
        """)
        
        for prop in listed_properties:
            # Search for listing
            search_results = await self.web_intel._google_search(
                f'"{prop["address"]}" zillow OR redfin'
            )
            
            if search_results:
                # Extract current price with AI
                current_data = await self.web_intel._extract_with_ai(
                    search_results[0]['url'],
                    prop['address']
                )
                
                if current_data.get('listing_price'):
                    # Price changed?
                    if current_data['listing_price'] != prop['listing_price']:
                        await self.db.execute("""
                            UPDATE base_leads
                            SET 
                                listing_price = $1,
                                listing_price_history = array_append(
                                    listing_price_history, 
                                    jsonb_build_object(
                                        'date', NOW(),
                                        'price', $1
                                    )
                                )
                            WHERE id = $2
                        """, current_data['listing_price'], prop['id'])
            
            await asyncio.sleep(2)

import httpx
from typing import Optional, List
import random
import asyncio
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

class ProxyManager:
    """
    Manage free and paid proxies with automatic rotation
    Avoids all blocks
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.proxies = []
        self.failed_proxies = set()
        self.proxy_stats = {}
        
    async def initialize(self):
        """
        Load free proxies from multiple sources
        """
        
        # Source 1: Free proxy lists (update every hour)
        free_proxies = await self._fetch_free_proxies()
        
        # Source 2: Your own proxy if you have VPS servers
        # Rent cheap VPS servers ($5/mo each) and use as proxies
        own_proxies = self._load_own_proxies()
        
        # Source 3: Tor network (100% free, slower)
        tor_proxies = self._get_tor_proxies()
        
        self.proxies = free_proxies + own_proxies + tor_proxies
        
        # Test all proxies
        await self._test_all_proxies()
        
        print(f"Loaded {len(self.proxies)} working proxies")
    
    async def _fetch_free_proxies(self) -> List[dict]:
        """
        Scrape free proxy lists
        Quality varies but free!
        """
        
        sources = [
            "https://www.proxy-list.download/api/v1/get?type=http",
            "https://api.proxyscrape.com/v2/?request=get&protocol=http",
            "https://www.proxyscan.io/download?type=http"
        ]
        
        all_proxies = []
        
        for source in sources:
            try:
                async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
                    response = await client.get(source, timeout=10)
                    
                    proxy_list = response.text.strip().split('\n')
                    
                    for proxy in proxy_list:
                        if ':' in proxy:
                            ip, port = proxy.split(':')
                            all_proxies.append({
                                'ip': ip,
                                'port': int(port),
                                'type': 'free',
                                'source': source
                            })
            except:
                continue
        
        return all_proxies
    
    def _load_own_proxies(self) -> List[dict]:
        """
        Load your own proxy servers
        
        PRO TIP: Rent 5-10 cheap VPS servers ($5/mo each)
        Install squid proxy on each
        Use as your own proxy pool
        Total cost: $25-50/mo for unlimited scraping
        """
        
        own_proxies = []
        
        # Load from config/env
        proxy_servers = os.getenv("OWN_PROXY_SERVERS", "").split(",")
        
        for server in proxy_servers:
            if server:
                ip, port = server.split(":")
                own_proxies.append({
                    'ip': ip,
                    'port': int(port),
                    'type': 'owned',
                    'priority': 'high'  # Use these first
                })
        
        return own_proxies
    
    def _get_tor_proxies(self) -> List[dict]:
        """
        Use Tor network (100% free, anonymous)
        Slower but unblockable
        """
        
        # Tor SOCKS5 proxy runs on localhost:9050
        return [{
            'ip': '127.0.0.1',
            'port': 9050,
            'type': 'tor',
            'socks': True
        }]
    
    async def _test_all_proxies(self):
        """
        Test each proxy's speed and reliability
        """
        
        test_url = "https://httpbin.org/ip"
        
        async def test_proxy(proxy):
            try:
                proxy_url = f"http://{proxy['ip']}:{proxy['port']}"
                
                start = datetime.now()
                
                async with httpx.AsyncClient(proxies=proxy_url, timeout=10) as client:
                    response = await client.get(test_url)
                    
                    if response.status_code == 200:
                        response_time = (datetime.now() - start).total_seconds()
                        
                        proxy['working'] = True
                        proxy['response_time'] = response_time
                        proxy['last_tested'] = datetime.now()
                        
                        return proxy
            except:
                pass
            
            return None
        
        # Test all in parallel
        tasks = [test_proxy(p) for p in self.proxies]
        results = await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
        
        # Keep only working proxies
        self.proxies = [p for p in results if p is not None]
        
        # Sort by response time
        self.proxies.sort(key=lambda x: x.get('response_time', 999))
    
    def get_proxy(self) -> Optional[str]:
        """
        Get a working proxy
        Rotate through pool
        """
        
        # Remove failed proxies
        available = [p for p in self.proxies if p['ip'] not in self.failed_proxies]
        
        if not available:
            # Reset failed list if all exhausted
            self.failed_proxies.clear()
            available = self.proxies
        
        if not available:
            return None
        
        # Prioritize owned proxies
        owned = [p for p in available if p.get('priority') == 'high']
        if owned:
            proxy = random.choice(owned)
        else:
            proxy = random.choice(available)
        
        if proxy.get('socks'):
            return f"socks5://{proxy['ip']}:{proxy['port']}"
        else:
            return f"http://{proxy['ip']}:{proxy['port']}"
    
    def mark_proxy_failed(self, proxy_url: str):
        """
        Mark proxy as failed
        """
        
        ip = proxy_url.split('//')[1].split(':')[0]
        self.failed_proxies.add(ip)
    
    async def refresh_proxies(self):
        """
        Refresh proxy list every hour
        """
        
        while True:
            await asyncio.sleep(3600)  # 1 hour
            
            print("Refreshing proxy list...")
            await self.initialize()

class RateLimiter:
    """
    Smart rate limiting to avoid detection
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.requests = {}
        self.limits = {
            'google': {'calls': 10, 'period': 60},  # 10 per minute
            'zillow': {'calls': 5, 'period': 60},
            'county': {'calls': 1, 'period': 1},  # 1 per second
            'default': {'calls': 30, 'period': 60}
        }
    
    async def wait_if_needed(self, domain: str):
        """
        Wait if we're hitting rate limit
        """
        
        # Determine limit for this domain
        limit_key = None
        for key in self.limits.keys():
            if key in domain:
                limit_key = key
                break
        
        if not limit_key:
            limit_key = 'default'
        
        limit = self.limits[limit_key]
        
        # Track requests
        if domain not in self.requests:
            self.requests[domain] = []
        
        # Remove old requests
        cutoff = datetime.now() - timedelta(seconds=limit['period'])
        self.requests[domain] = [
            req for req in self.requests[domain]
            if req > cutoff
        ]
        
        # Check if we're at limit
        if len(self.requests[domain]) >= limit['calls']:
            # Wait until oldest request expires
            oldest = min(self.requests[domain])
            wait_time = (oldest + timedelta(seconds=limit['period']) - datetime.now()).total_seconds()
            
            if wait_time > 0:
                # Add random jitter (looks more human)
                wait_time += random.uniform(0.5, 2.0)
                await asyncio.sleep(wait_time)
        
        # Record this request
        self.requests[domain].append(datetime.now())


class SmartScraper:
    """
    Combines all anti-blocking techniques
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        self.proxy_manager = ProxyManager()
        self.ua_rotator = UserAgentRotator()
        self.rate_limiter = RateLimiter()
        
    async def initialize(self):
        await self.proxy_manager.initialize()
    
    async def fetch(self, url: str, use_proxy: bool = True, max_retries: int = 3) -> Optional[str]:
        """
        Fetch URL with all anti-blocking measures
        """
        
        from urllib.parse import urlparse
        domain = urlparse(url).netloc
        
        # Rate limit
        await self.rate_limiter.wait_if_needed(domain)
        
        for attempt in range(max_retries):
            try:
                # Get proxy if requested
                proxy = self.proxy_manager.get_proxy() if use_proxy else None
                
                # Get random headers
                headers = self.ua_rotator.get_headers()
                
                # Add random delay (look human)
                await asyncio.sleep(random.uniform(1.0, 3.0))
                
                # Make request
                async with httpx.AsyncClient(
                    proxies=proxy,
                    headers=headers,
                    timeout=30.0,
                    follow_redirects=True
                ) as client:
                    response = await client.get(url)
                    
                    if response.status_code == 200:
                        return response.text
                    elif response.status_code == 403 or response.status_code == 429:
                        # Blocked - try next proxy
                        if proxy:
                            self.proxy_manager.mark_proxy_failed(proxy)
                        
                        await asyncio.sleep(random.uniform(5.0, 10.0))
                        continue
                    
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"Attempt {attempt + 1} failed: {e}")
                
                if proxy:
                    self.proxy_manager.mark_proxy_failed(proxy)
                
                if attempt < max_retries - 1:
                    # Exponential backoff
                    await asyncio.sleep(2 ** attempt)
        
        return None

from sklearn.cluster import DBSCAN
import numpy as np
from typing import List, Dict
import asyncio

class PropertyClusterAnalyzer:
    """
    Find clusters of roofing activity
    Identifies "hot zones" where multiple homes got new roofs
    """
    
    def __init__(self, db):
        self.db = db
    
    async def find_roofing_clusters(
        self,
        city: str,
        state: str,
        days: int = 90,
        min_cluster_size: int = 3,
        radius_miles: float = 0.5
    ) -> List[Dict]:
        """
        Find geographic clusters of recent roofing activity
        
        Returns hotspots where neighbors are getting roofs done
        = Perfect lead generation opportunity
        """
        
        # Get all recent roofing permits
        permits = await self.db.fetch("""
            SELECT 
                permit_number,
                address,
                lat,
                lng,
                issue_date,
                estimated_value,
                contractor_name
            FROM roofing_permits
            WHERE city = $1 
            AND state = $2
            AND issue_date >= NOW() - INTERVAL '$3 days'
            AND lat IS NOT NULL
            AND lng IS NOT NULL
        """, city, state, days)
        
        if len(permits) < min_cluster_size:
            return []
        
        # Prepare coordinates for clustering
        coords = np.array([[p['lat'], p['lng']] for p in permits])
        
        # Convert radius from miles to degrees (approximate)
        # 1 degree â‰ˆ 69 miles
        eps_degrees = radius_miles / 69.0
        
        # Run DBSCAN clustering
        clustering = DBSCAN(
            eps=eps_degrees,
            min_samples=min_cluster_size,
            metric='euclidean'
        ).fit(coords)
        
        labels = clustering.labels_
        
        # Extract clusters (label -1 is noise/outliers)
        clusters = {}
        for idx, label in enumerate(labels):
            if label != -1:  # Ignore outliers
                if label not in clusters:
                    clusters[label] = []
                clusters[label].append(permits[idx])
        
        # Analyze each cluster
        cluster_analysis = []
        
        for cluster_id, cluster_permits in clusters.items():
            # Calculate cluster center
            center_lat = np.mean([p['lat'] for p in cluster_permits])
            center_lng = np.mean([p['lng'] for p in cluster_permits])
            
            # Find properties near cluster that DON'T have recent permits
            # These are HOT LEADS
            potential_leads = await self._find_neighbors_without_permits(
                center_lat,
                center_lng,
                radius_miles,
                city,
                state,
                days
            )
            
            # Calculate cluster statistics
            avg_value = np.mean([p['estimated_value'] or 0 for p in cluster_permits])
            
            cluster_info = {
                'cluster_id': cluster_id,
                'center_lat': center_lat,
                'center_lng': center_lng,
                'permit_count': len(cluster_permits),
                'permits': cluster_permits,
                'avg_project_value': avg_value,
                'potential_leads': potential_leads,
                'lead_count': len(potential_leads),
                'most_common_contractor': self._find_most_common(
                    [p['contractor_name'] for p in cluster_permits if p['contractor_name']]
                ),
                'cluster_quality_score': self._calculate_cluster_score(
                    len(cluster_permits),
                    len(potential_leads),
                    avg_value
                )
            }
            
            cluster_analysis.append(cluster_info)
        
        # Sort by quality score
        cluster_analysis.sort(key=lambda x: x['cluster_quality_score'], reverse=True)
        
        return cluster_analysis
    
    async def _find_neighbors_without_permits(
        self,
        center_lat: float,
        center_lng: float,
        radius_miles: float,
        city: str,
        state: str,
        days: int
    ) -> List[Dict]:
        """
        Find properties near cluster that HAVEN'T had roof work
        These are your best leads!
        """
        
        # Find all properties in radius
        nearby_properties = await self.db.fetch("""
            SELECT 
                bl.id,
                bl.address,
                bl.lat,
                bl.lng,
                bl.year_built,
                bl.property_value,
                rl.estimated_roof_age,
                (
                    3959 * acos(
                        cos(radians($1)) * cos(radians(bl.lat)) * 
                        cos(radians(bl.lng) - radians($2)) + 
                        sin(radians($1)) * sin(radians(bl.lat))
                    )
                ) AS distance_miles
            FROM base_leads bl
            INNER JOIN roofing_leads rl ON bl.id = rl.base_lead_id
            WHERE bl.city = $3
            AND bl.state = $4
            AND (
                3959 * acos(
                    cos(radians($1)) * cos(radians(bl.lat)) * 
                    cos(radians(bl.lng) - radians($2)) + 
                    sin(radians($1)) * sin(radians(bl.lat))
                )
            ) <= $5
            AND bl.id NOT IN (
                SELECT DISTINCT base_lead_id
                FROM roofing_leads rl2
                WHERE rl2.last_permit_date >= NOW() - INTERVAL '$6 days'
            )
            ORDER BY distance_miles
        """, center_lat, center_lng, city, state, radius_miles, days)
        
        # Score each property
        leads = []
        for prop in nearby_properties:
            quality_score = self._score_cluster_lead(
                prop,
                distance_miles=prop['distance_miles']
            )
            
            if quality_score >= 75:  # High quality threshold
                leads.append({
                    **dict(prop),
                    'cluster_quality_score': quality_score,
                    'lead_reason': 'neighbor_cluster',
                    'neighbor_count': len(nearby_properties)
                })
        
        return leads
    
    def _score_cluster_lead(self, property_data: dict, distance_miles: float) -> int:
        """
        Score a lead that's near a roofing cluster
        """
        
        score = 0
        
        # Roof age (40% weight) - older = better
        roof_age = property_data.get('estimated_roof_age', 0)
        if roof_age >= 20:
            score += 40
        elif roof_age >= 15:
            score += 32
        elif roof_age >= 10:
            score += 24
        
        # Distance to cluster (30% weight) - closer = better
        if distance_miles <= 0.1:
            score += 30
        elif distance_miles <= 0.25:
            score += 25
        elif distance_miles <= 0.5:
            score += 20
        
        # Property value (20% weight)
        value = property_data.get('property_value', 0)
        if value >= 400000:
            score += 20
        elif value >= 250000:
            score += 15
        
        # Cluster bonus (10% weight) - being in active cluster is huge signal
        score += 10
        
        return min(score, 100)
    
    def _calculate_cluster_score(
        self,
        permit_count: int,
        lead_count: int,
        avg_value: float
    ) -> int:
        """
        Score the quality of a cluster
        """
        
        score = 0
        
        # More permits = better cluster
        score += min(permit_count * 5, 40)
        
        # More potential leads = better opportunity
        score += min(lead_count * 3, 40)
        
        # Higher value projects = better neighborhood
        if avg_value >= 15000:
            score += 20
        elif avg_value >= 10000:
            score += 10
        
        return min(score, 100)
    
    def _find_most_common(self, items: List) -> Optional[str]:
        """
        Find most frequent item
        """
        if not items:
            return None
        
        from collections import Counter
        counter = Counter(items)
        return counter.most_common(1)[0][0] if counter else None
    
    async def generate_cluster_report(
        self,
        city: str,
        state: str
    ) -> Dict:
        """
        Generate complete cluster analysis report
        """
        
        clusters = await self.find_roofing_clusters(city, state)
        
        # Aggregate statistics
        total_clusters = len(clusters)
        total_permits = sum(c['permit_count'] for c in clusters)
        total_leads = sum(c['lead_count'] for c in clusters)
        
        # Top clusters
        top_clusters = clusters[:5]
        
        return {
            'city': city,
            'state': state,
            'analysis_date': datetime.now().isoformat(),
            'summary': {
                'total_clusters': total_clusters,
                'total_permits_in_clusters': total_permits,
                'total_potential_leads': total_leads,
                'avg_leads_per_cluster': total_leads / total_clusters if total_clusters else 0
            },
            'top_clusters': top_clusters,
            'all_clusters': clusters
        }

            'zillow_photos',         # Free scrape
            'redfin_photos',         # Free scrape
            'realtor_photos',        # Free scrape
            'county_photos',         # Sometimes available
            'street_view_download'   # Archive.org Street View
        ]
    
    async def get_all_property_images(
        self,
        address: str,
        lat: float,
        lng: float
    ) -> Dict:
        """
        Get every possible image of a property
        """
        
        images = {
            'aerial': [],
            'street_view': [],
            'listing_photos': [],
            'sources_used': []
        }
        
        # 1. Aerial/Satellite Images
        aerial_tasks = [
            self._get_mapbox_satellite(lat, lng),
            self._get_google_static_map(lat, lng),
            self._get_bing_aerial(lat, lng)
        ]
        
        aerial_results = await asyncio.gather(*aerial_tasks, return_exceptions=True)
        
        for result in aerial_results:
            if result and not isinstance(result, Exception):
                images['aerial'].append(result)
                images['sources_used'].append(result['source'])
        
        # 2. Street View Images
        street_tasks = [
            self._get_mapillary_street_view(lat, lng),
            self._get_google_street_view(lat, lng),
            self._get_bing_street_view(lat, lng)
        ]
        
        street_results = await asyncio.gather(*street_tasks, return_exceptions=True)
        
        for result in street_results:
            if result and not isinstance(result, Exception):
                images['street_view'].append(result)
                images['sources_used'].append(result['source'])
        
        # 3. Listing Photos (if property listed)
        listing_tasks = [
            self._scrape_zillow_photos(address),
            self._scrape_redfin_photos(address),
            self._scrape_realtor_photos(address)
        ]
        
        listing_results = await asyncio.gather(*listing_tasks, return_exceptions=True)
        
        for result in listing_results:
            if result and not isinstance(result, Exception):
                images['listing_photos'].extend(result.get('photos', []))
                if result.get('photos'):
                    images['sources_used'].append(result['source'])
        
        return images
    
    async def _get_mapbox_satellite(self, lat: float, lng: float) -> Optional[Dict]:
        """

        """
        
        mapbox_token = os.getenv("MAPBOX_TOKEN")
        
        # Generate multiple angles/zooms
        images = []
        
        for zoom in [18, 19]:  # High detail
            url = f"https://api.mapbox.com/styles/v1/mapbox/satellite-v9/static/{lng},{lat},{zoom},0/1280x1280@2x"
            
            params = {"access_token": mapbox_token}
            
            try:
                async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
                    response = await client.get(url, params=params, timeout=30)
                    
                    if response.status_code == 200:

                        })
            except:

    async def _get_google_street_view(self, lat: float, lng: float) -> Optional[Dict]:

                        with open(filepath, "wb") as f:

                        images.append({

                            'heading': heading,

                        })
            except:

    async def _scrape_zillow_photos(self, address: str) -> Optional[Dict]:
        """
        Scrape property photos from Zillow
        100% FREE
        """
        
        # Search Zillow for address
        search_query = address.replace(" ", "-").replace(",", "")
        zillow_url = f"https://www.zillow.com/homes/{search_query}_rb/"
        
        html = await self.scraper.fetch(zillow_url, use_proxy=True)
        
        if not html:
            return None
        
        from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
        soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
        
        # Extract images
        photos = []
        
        # Method 1: Find image gallery
        gallery_script = soup.find('script', {'id': 'hdpApolloPreloadedData'})
        
        if gallery_script:
            import json
            import re
            
            # Extract JSON data
            json_text = gallery_script.string
            
            try:
                # Find image URLs in JSON
                image_urls = re.findall(r'https://photos\.zillowstatic\.com/[^"]+', json_text)
                
                # Get high-res versions
                for url in image_urls[:20]:  # Limit to 20 photos
                    # Replace with high-res
                    high_res_url = url.replace('/p_e/', '/p_h/')
                    
                    photos.append({
                        'url': high_res_url,
                        'type': 'listing_photo'
                    })
            except:
                pass
        
        # Method 2: Find image tags
        if not photos:
            img_tags = soup.find_all('img', {'class': re.compile('photo')})
            
            for img in img_tags:
                src = img.get('src') or img.get('data-src')
                if src and 'photos.zillowstatic.com' in src:
                    photos.append({
                        'url': src,
                        'type': 'listing_photo'
                    })
        
        if photos:
            return {
                'source': 'zillow',
                'photos': photos,
                'cost': 0.0
            }
        
        return None

    async def _upload_to_storage(self, filepath: str) -> str:
        """
        Upload image to your storage (S3, Cloudflare R2, etc.)
        """
        
        import boto3
        
        s3 = boto3.client('s3')
        
        filename = os.path.basename(filepath)
        bucket = os.getenv("AWS_S3_BUCKET")
        
        s3.upload_file(
            filepath,
            bucket,
            f"property-images/{filename}",
            ExtraArgs={'ACL': 'public-read'}
        )
        
        url = f"https://{bucket}.s3.amazonaws.com/property-images/{filename}"
        
        return url

class CompleteRoofingLeadSystem:
    """
    THE COMPLETE SYSTEM
    Everything you need, zero API costs
    """
    
    def __init__(self, db):
        self.db = db
        self.scraper = SmartScraper()
        self.cluster_analyzer = PropertyClusterAnalyzer(db)
        self.image_service = UniversalImageAcquisition()
        
    async def initialize(self):
        """Initialize all systems"""
        await self.scraper.initialize()
    
    async def generate_roofing_leads(
        self,
        city: str,
        state: str,
        target_count: int = 100
    ) -> List[Dict]:
        """
        Generate complete roofing leads with:
        - Permit data
        - Property details
        - Neighbor analysis
        - Cluster detection
        - Multiple images
        - AI insights
        
        All for $0 in data costs
        """
        
        print(f"Generating {target_count} roofing leads for {city}, {state}")
        
        # Step 1: Find roofing clusters (hotspots)
        print("Step 1: Finding roofing activity clusters...")
        clusters = await self.cluster_analyzer.find_roofing_clusters(
            city, state, days=90
        )
        
        print(f"  Found {len(clusters)} active roofing clusters")
        
        # Step 2: Extract leads from clusters
        all_leads = []
        
        for cluster in clusters:
            all_leads.extend(cluster['potential_leads'])
        
        print(f"  Extracted {len(all_leads)} leads from clusters")
        
        # Step 3: If we need more leads, scrape new permits
        if len(all_leads) < target_count:
            print(f"Step 2: Scraping recent permits for additional leads...")
            
            additional_leads = await self._generate_from_permits(
                city, state, needed=target_count - len(all_leads)
            )
            
            all_leads.extend(additional_leads)
        
        # Step 4: Sort by quality and take top N
        all_leads.sort(key=lambda x: x.get('quality_score', 0), reverse=True)
        top_leads = all_leads[:target_count]
        
        print(f"Step 3: Enriching {len(top_leads)} leads with images and insights...")
        
        # Step 5: Enrich each lead (parallel)
        enrichment_tasks = [
            self._enrich_lead_completely(lead)
            for lead in top_leads
        ]
        
        enriched_leads = await asyncio.gather(*enrichment_tasks)
        
        # Step 6: Save to database
        print("Step 4: Saving to database...")
        
        for lead in enriched_leads:
            await self._save_lead(lead)
        
        print(f"âœ… Generated {len(enriched_leads)} complete roofing leads")
        print(f"   Average quality score: {np.mean([l['quality_score'] for l in enriched_leads]):.1f}")
        print(f"   Total cost: $0 (just server time)")
        
        return enriched_leads

    async def _analyze_roof_with_ai(self, image_url: str) -> Dict:

}"""

python# backend/app/vision/image_preprocessing.py

import cv2
import numpy as np
from PIL import Image
import torch
from torchvision import transforms
from typing import Dict, List, Tuple
import io

class AdvancedImagePreprocessor:
    """
    Advanced image preprocessing to reveal roof damage
    Multiple transformations to detect different issue types
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        # Load super-resolution model (runs locally)
        self.sr_model = self._load_super_resolution_model()
        
    def _load_super_resolution_model(self):
        """
        Load ESRGAN or Real-ESRGAN for image upscaling
        Runs locally, no API needed
        """
        from basicsr.archs.rrdbnet_arch import RRDBNet
        from realesrgan import RealESRGANer
        
        model = RRDBNet(
            num_in_ch=3,
            num_out_ch=3,
            num_feat=64,
            num_block=23,
            num_grow_ch=32,
            scale=4
        )
        
        # Download model weights once
        model_path = '/models/RealESRGAN_x4plus.pth'
        
        upsampler = RealESRGANer(
            scale=4,
            model_path=model_path,
            model=model,
            tile=400,
            tile_pad=10,
            pre_pad=0,
            half=True  # FP16 for speed
        )
        
        return upsampler
    
    def preprocess_image(self, image_path: str) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
        """
        Complete preprocessing pipeline
        Returns multiple enhanced versions
        """
        
        # Load image
        img = cv2.imread(image_path)
        img_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB)
        
        enhanced_images = {}
        
        # 1. Super-resolution (enhance quality)
        print("  â†’ Super-resolution enhancement...")
        enhanced_images['super_res'] = self._super_resolve(img_rgb)
        
        # 2. Denoise
        print("  â†’ Denoising...")
        enhanced_images['denoised'] = self._denoise(img_rgb)
        
        # 3. Contrast enhancement (CLAHE)
        print("  â†’ Contrast enhancement...")
        enhanced_images['contrast'] = self._enhance_contrast(img_rgb)
        
        # 4. Shadow removal
        print("  â†’ Shadow removal...")
        enhanced_images['shadow_removed'] = self._remove_shadows(img_rgb)
        
        # 5. Color correction
        print("  â†’ Color correction...")
        enhanced_images['color_corrected'] = self._correct_colors(img_rgb)
        
        # 6. Sharpening
        print("  â†’ Sharpening...")
        enhanced_images['sharpened'] = self._sharpen(img_rgb)
        
        # 7. HDR-like enhancement
        print("  â†’ HDR enhancement...")
        enhanced_images['hdr'] = self._hdr_enhancement(img_rgb)
        
        return enhanced_images
    
    def _super_resolve(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Upscale image 4x using Real-ESRGAN
        Reveals fine details
        """
        try:
            output, _ = self.sr_model.enhance(img, outscale=4)
            return output
        except:
            # Fallback to bicubic if model fails
            h, w = img.shape[:2]
            return cv2.resize(img, (w*4, h*4), interpolation=cv2.INTER_CUBIC)
    
    def _denoise(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Advanced denoising while preserving edges
        """
        # Non-local means denoising
        denoised = cv2.fastNlMeansDenoisingColored(
            img,
            None,
            h=10,
            hColor=10,
            templateWindowSize=7,
            searchWindowSize=21
        )
        
        return denoised
    
    def _enhance_contrast(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        CLAHE (Contrast Limited Adaptive Histogram Equalization)
        Reveals damage in dark/bright areas
        """
        # Convert to LAB color space
        lab = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2LAB)
        
        # Apply CLAHE to L channel
        clahe = cv2.createCLAHE(clipLimit=3.0, tileGridSize=(8,8))
        lab[:,:,0] = clahe.apply(lab[:,:,0])
        
        # Convert back to RGB
        enhanced = cv2.cvtColor(lab, cv2.COLOR_LAB2RGB)
        
        return enhanced
    
    def _remove_shadows(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Remove shadows to see damage underneath
        """
        # Convert to LAB
        lab = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2LAB)
        l, a, b = cv2.split(lab)
        
        # Apply morphological operations to detect shadows
        kernel = cv2.getStructuringElement(cv2.MORPH_ELLIPSE, (5,5))
        
        # Dilate L channel
        dilated = cv2.dilate(l, kernel, iterations=2)
        
        # Background estimation
        bg = cv2.medianBlur(dilated, 21)
        
        # Calculate difference
        diff = cv2.absdiff(l, bg)
        
        # Normalize
        norm = cv2.normalize(diff, None, 0, 255, cv2.NORM_MINMAX)
        
        # Merge back
        lab_adjusted = cv2.merge([norm, a, b])
        shadow_removed = cv2.cvtColor(lab_adjusted, cv2.COLOR_LAB2RGB)
        
        return shadow_removed
    
    def _correct_colors(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Automatic color correction
        Normalizes for different lighting conditions
        """
        # White balance
        result = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2LAB)
        avg_a = np.average(result[:, :, 1])
        avg_b = np.average(result[:, :, 2])
        
        result[:, :, 1] = result[:, :, 1] - ((avg_a - 128) * (result[:, :, 0] / 255.0) * 1.1)
        result[:, :, 2] = result[:, :, 2] - ((avg_b - 128) * (result[:, :, 0] / 255.0) * 1.1)
        
        corrected = cv2.cvtColor(result, cv2.COLOR_LAB2RGB)
        
        return corrected
    
    def _sharpen(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Unsharp masking for detail enhancement
        """
        # Create Gaussian blur
        gaussian = cv2.GaussianBlur(img, (0, 0), 2.0)
        
        # Unsharp mask
        sharpened = cv2.addWeighted(img, 1.5, gaussian, -0.5, 0)
        
        return np.clip(sharpened, 0, 255).astype(np.uint8)
    
    def _hdr_enhancement(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        HDR-like enhancement
        Brings out details in highlights and shadows
        """
        # Convert to float
        img_float = img.astype(np.float32) / 255.0
        
        # Apply tone mapping
        tonemap = cv2.createTonemapDrago(gamma=2.2, saturation=1.0)
        hdr = tonemap.process(img_float)
        
        # Back to uint8
        hdr = np.clip(hdr * 255, 0, 255).astype(np.uint8)
        
        return hdr


class DamageSpecificTransformations:
    """
    Specialized transformations to detect specific damage types
    """
    
    def apply_all_transformations(self, img: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
        """
        Apply all damage-detection transformations
        """
        
        transformations = {}
        
        # 1. Crack detection (edge-based)
        transformations['crack_detection'] = self._crack_detection_transform(img)
        
        # 2. Algae/moss detection (color-based)
        transformations['algae_detection'] = self._algae_detection_transform(img)
        
        # 3. Missing shingles (texture-based)
        transformations['texture_analysis'] = self._texture_analysis_transform(img)
        
        # 4. Rust/corrosion (color-based)
        transformations['rust_detection'] = self._rust_detection_transform(img)
        
        # 5. Sagging/warping (geometric)
        transformations['geometric_analysis'] = self._geometric_analysis_transform(img)
        
        # 6. Moisture/water damage (spectral)
        transformations['moisture_detection'] = self._moisture_detection_transform(img)
        
        # 7. Age assessment (texture + color)
        transformations['age_analysis'] = self._age_analysis_transform(img)
        
        # 8. Hail damage (dent detection)
        transformations['hail_damage'] = self._hail_damage_transform(img)
        
        return transformations
    
    def _crack_detection_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Enhance cracks using edge detection
        """
        # Convert to grayscale
        gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
        
        # Apply bilateral filter (smooth while preserving edges)
        bilateral = cv2.bilateralFilter(gray, 9, 75, 75)
        
        # Canny edge detection
        edges = cv2.Canny(bilateral, 50, 150)
        
        # Morphological operations to connect broken edges
        kernel = np.ones((3,3), np.uint8)
        dilated = cv2.dilate(edges, kernel, iterations=1)
        
        # Convert back to 3 channels for consistency
        crack_map = cv2.cvtColor(dilated, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return crack_map
    
    def _algae_detection_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect algae/moss (green/black discoloration)
        """
        # Convert to HSV
        hsv = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2HSV)
        
        # Define range for green (algae)
        lower_green = np.array([35, 40, 40])
        upper_green = np.array([85, 255, 255])
        
        # Define range for dark (black algae)
        lower_dark = np.array([0, 0, 0])
        upper_dark = np.array([180, 255, 50])
        
        # Create masks
        green_mask = cv2.inRange(hsv, lower_green, upper_green)
        dark_mask = cv2.inRange(hsv, lower_dark, upper_dark)
        
        # Combine masks
        combined_mask = cv2.bitwise_or(green_mask, dark_mask)
        
        # Apply morphological operations to remove noise
        kernel = np.ones((5,5), np.uint8)
        cleaned = cv2.morphologyEx(combined_mask, cv2.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel)
        cleaned = cv2.morphologyEx(cleaned, cv2.MORPH_OPEN, kernel)
        
        # Convert to RGB
        algae_map = cv2.cvtColor(cleaned, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return algae_map
    
    def _texture_analysis_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect missing/damaged shingles via texture analysis
        """
        # Convert to grayscale
        gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
        
        # Calculate local standard deviation (texture measure)
        kernel_size = 15
        mean = cv2.blur(gray, (kernel_size, kernel_size))
        mean_sq = cv2.blur(gray**2, (kernel_size, kernel_size))
        variance = mean_sq - mean**2
        std_dev = np.sqrt(np.maximum(variance, 0))
        
        # Normalize
        texture_map = cv2.normalize(std_dev, None, 0, 255, cv2.NORM_MINMAX).astype(np.uint8)
        
        # Apply threshold to highlight irregular textures
        _, thresh = cv2.threshold(texture_map, 0, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY + cv2.THRESH_OTSU)
        
        # Convert to RGB
        texture_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(thresh, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return texture_rgb
    
    def _rust_detection_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect rust/corrosion (orange/brown discoloration)
        """
        # Convert to LAB for better color separation
        lab = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2LAB)
        
        # Extract channels
        l, a, b = cv2.split(lab)
        
        # Rust is characterized by high 'a' (red) and high 'b' (yellow)
        rust_score = (a.astype(float) + b.astype(float)) / 2
        rust_score = np.clip(rust_score, 0, 255).astype(np.uint8)
        
        # Threshold
        _, rust_mask = cv2.threshold(rust_score, 140, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY)
        
        # Clean up
        kernel = np.ones((5,5), np.uint8)
        rust_mask = cv2.morphologyEx(rust_mask, cv2.MORPH_OPEN, kernel)
        
        # Convert to RGB
        rust_map = cv2.cvtColor(rust_mask, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return rust_map
    
    def _geometric_analysis_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect sagging/warping via line detection
        """
        # Convert to grayscale
        gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
        
        # Edge detection
        edges = cv2.Canny(gray, 50, 150, apertureSize=3)
        
        # Hough line transform
        lines = cv2.HoughLinesP(
            edges,
            rho=1,
            theta=np.pi/180,
            threshold=50,
            minLineLength=100,
            maxLineGap=10
        )
        
        # Create line map
        line_map = np.zeros_like(img)
        
        if lines is not None:
            for line in lines:
                x1, y1, x2, y2 = line[0]
                cv2.line(line_map, (x1, y1), (x2, y2), (255, 255, 255), 2)
        
        return line_map
    
    def _moisture_detection_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect moisture/water stains
        Dark patches with specific color characteristics
        """
        # Convert to HSV
        hsv = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2HSV)
        h, s, v = cv2.split(hsv)
        
        # Moisture typically appears as dark areas with low saturation
        dark_areas = v < 100
        low_sat = s < 50
        
        moisture_mask = (dark_areas & low_sat).astype(np.uint8) * 255
        
        # Clean up
        kernel = np.ones((7,7), np.uint8)
        moisture_mask = cv2.morphologyEx(moisture_mask, cv2.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel)
        
        # Convert to RGB
        moisture_map = cv2.cvtColor(moisture_mask, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return moisture_map
    
    def _age_analysis_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Analyze roof age based on color fading and texture degradation
        """
        # Convert to LAB
        lab = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2LAB)
        l, a, b = cv2.split(lab)
        
        # Calculate color variance (fading indicator)
        color_var = np.var(a) + np.var(b)
        
        # Calculate texture sharpness (degradation indicator)
        gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
        laplacian_var = cv2.Laplacian(gray, cv2.CV_64F).var()
        
        # Combine metrics
        # Lower variance = more faded = older
        # Lower laplacian = less texture = more degraded
        
        age_score = np.zeros_like(gray, dtype=np.float32)
        age_score[:] = (1.0 / (1.0 + color_var)) * 255
        
        age_map = age_score.astype(np.uint8)
        age_map_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(age_map, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
        
        return age_map_rgb
    
    def _hail_damage_transform(self, img: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
        """
        Detect hail damage (circular dents/impacts)
        """
        # Convert to grayscale
        gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_RGB2GRAY)
        
        # Enhance contrast
        clahe = cv2.createCLAHE(clipLimit=2.0, tileGridSize=(8,8))
        enhanced = clahe.apply(gray)
        
        # Detect circles (hail dents are often circular)
        circles = cv2.HoughCircles(
            enhanced,
            cv2.HOUGH_GRADIENT,
            dp=1,
            minDist=20,
            param1=50,
            param2=30,
            minRadius=5,
            maxRadius=30
        )
        
        # Create hail damage map
        hail_map = np.zeros_like(img)
        
        if circles is not None:
            circles = np.uint16(np.around(circles))
            for circle in circles[0, :]:
                center = (circle[0], circle[1])
                radius = circle[2]
                cv2.circle(hail_map, center, radius, (255, 255, 255), 2)
        
        return hail_map

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
from torch.utils.data import Dataset, DataLoader
from torchvision import models, transforms
import pytorch_lightning as pl
from typing import List, Dict, Tuple
import albumentations as A
from albumentations.pytorch import ToTensorV2

class RoofDamageDataset(Dataset):
    """
    Custom dataset for roof damage detection
    """
    
    def __init__(
        self,
        image_paths: List[str],
        labels: List[Dict],
        transform=None
    ):
        self.image_paths = image_paths
        self.labels = labels
        self.transform = transform
        
        # Damage types
        self.damage_classes = [
            'no_damage',
            'missing_shingles',
            'cracks',
            'algae_moss',
            'rust_corrosion',
            'sagging_warping',
            'hail_damage',
            'water_damage',
            'age_deterioration'
        ]
    
    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.image_paths)
    
    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        # Load image
        img = cv2.imread(self.image_paths[idx])
        img = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB)
        
        # Get label
        label_dict = self.labels[idx]
        
        # Multi-label classification (roof can have multiple issues)
        label_vector = np.zeros(len(self.damage_classes), dtype=np.float32)
        
        for damage_type in label_dict.get('damage_types', []):
            if damage_type in self.damage_classes:
                idx = self.damage_classes.index(damage_type)
                label_vector[idx] = 1.0
        
        # Apply transformations
        if self.transform:
            augmented = self.transform(image=img)
            img = augmented['image']
        
        return img, torch.FloatTensor(label_vector)


class RoofDamageDetector(pl.LightningModule):
    """
    Lightweight multi-label classification model
    Based on EfficientNet-B0 (only 5.3M parameters)
    Runs fast on CPU or GPU
    """
    
    def __init__(
        self,
        num_classes: int = 9,
        learning_rate: float = 1e-4
    ):
        super().__init__()
        
        self.learning_rate = learning_rate
        
        # Use EfficientNet-B0 as backbone
        self.backbone = models.efficientnet_b0(pretrained=True)
        
        # Replace classifier
        num_features = self.backbone.classifier[1].in_features
        self.backbone.classifier = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Dropout(0.3),
            nn.Linear(num_features, 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Dropout(0.2),
            nn.Linear(512, num_classes)
        )
        
        # Loss function (multi-label)
        self.criterion = nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
    
    def forward(self, x):
        return self.backbone(x)
    
    def training_step(self, batch, batch_idx):
        images, labels = batch
        logits = self(images)
        loss = self.criterion(logits, labels)
        
        self.log('train_loss', loss)
        return loss
    
    def validation_step(self, batch, batch_idx):
        images, labels = batch
        logits = self(images)
        loss = self.criterion(logits, labels)
        
        # Calculate accuracy
        preds = torch.sigmoid(logits) > 0.5
        accuracy = (preds == labels).float().mean()
        
        self.log('val_loss', loss)
        self.log('val_accuracy', accuracy)
        
        return loss
    
    def configure_optimizers(self):
        optimizer = torch.optim.AdamW(
            self.parameters(),
            lr=self.learning_rate,
            weight_decay=0.01
        )
        
        scheduler = torch.optim.lr_scheduler.CosineAnnealingLR(
            optimizer,
            T_max=100
        )
        
        return [optimizer], [scheduler]


class YOLOv8RoofDetector:
    """
    YOLOv8 for object detection
    Detects specific damage instances
    """
    
    def __init__(self, model_path: str = None):
        from ultralytics import YOLO
        
        if model_path and os.path.exists(model_path):
            # Load trained model
            self.model = YOLO(model_path)
        else:
            # Start with pretrained YOLOv8n (nano - fastest)
            self.model = YOLO('yolov8n.pt')
    
    def train(
        self,
        data_yaml_path: str,
        epochs: int = 100,
        imgsz: int = 640
    ):
        """
        Train YOLOv8 on custom roof damage dataset
        """
        
        results = self.model.train(
            data=data_yaml_path,
            epochs=epochs,
            imgsz=imgsz,
            patience=20,
            batch=16,
            device='cuda' if torch.cuda.is_available() else 'cpu',
            workers=4,
            augment=True
        )
        
        return results
    
    def detect(self, image_path: str, conf_threshold: float = 0.25):
        """
        Detect roof damage in image
        """
        
        results = self.model.predict(
            image_path,
            conf=conf_threshold,
            iou=0.45,
            imgsz=640
        )
        
        detections = []
        
        for result in results:
            boxes = result.boxes
            
            for box in boxes:
                detection = {
                    'class_id': int(box.cls[0]),
                    'class_name': result.names[int(box.cls[0])],
                    'confidence': float(box.conf[0]),
                    'bbox': box.xyxy[0].tolist(),  # [x1, y1, x2, y2]
                    'area': float((box.xyxy[0][2] - box.xyxy[0][0]) * (box.xyxy[0][3] - box.xyxy[0][1]))
                }
                
                detections.append(detection)
        
        return detections


class UNetSegmentationModel(pl.LightningModule):
    """
    U-Net for damage segmentation
    Pixel-level damage mapping
    """
    
    def __init__(self, in_channels=3, num_classes=9):
        super().__init__()
        
        # Encoder (downsampling)
        self.enc1 = self._conv_block(in_channels, 64)
        self.enc2 = self._conv_block(64, 128)
        self.enc3 = self._conv_block(128, 256)
        self.enc4 = self._conv_block(256, 512)
        
        # Bottleneck
        self.bottleneck = self._conv_block(512, 1024)
        
        # Decoder (upsampling)
        self.upconv4 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(1024, 512, 2, stride=2)
        self.dec4 = self._conv_block(1024, 512)
        
        self.upconv3 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(512, 256, 2, stride=2)
        self.dec3 = self._conv_block(512, 256)
        
        self.upconv2 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(256, 128, 2, stride=2)
        self.dec2 = self._conv_block(256, 128)
        
        self.upconv1 = nn.ConvTranspose2d(128, 64, 2, stride=2)
        self.dec1 = self._conv_block(128, 64)
        
        # Output
        self.out = nn.Conv2d(64, num_classes, 1)
        
        self.pool = nn.MaxPool2d(2)
        
        # Loss
        self.criterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()
    
    def _conv_block(self, in_ch, out_ch):
        return nn.Sequential(
            nn.Conv2d(in_ch, out_ch, 3, padding=1),
            nn.BatchNorm2d(out_ch),
            nn.ReLU(inplace=True),
            nn.Conv2d(out_ch, out_ch, 3, padding=1),
            nn.BatchNorm2d(out_ch),
            nn.ReLU(inplace=True)
        )
    
    def forward(self, x):
        # Encoder
        enc1 = self.enc1(x)
        enc2 = self.enc2(self.pool(enc1))
        enc3 = self.enc3(self.pool(enc2))
        enc4 = self.enc4(self.pool(enc3))
        
        # Bottleneck
        bottleneck = self.bottleneck(self.pool(enc4))
        
        # Decoder with skip connections
        dec4 = self.upconv4(bottleneck)
        dec4 = torch.cat([dec4, enc4], dim=1)
        dec4 = self.dec4(dec4)
        
        dec3 = self.upconv3(dec4)
        dec3 = torch.cat([dec3, enc3], dim=1)
        dec3 = self.dec3(dec3)
        
        dec2 = self.upconv2(dec3)
        dec2 = torch.cat([dec2, enc2], dim=1)
        dec2 = self.dec2(dec2)
        
        dec1 = self.upconv1(dec2)
        dec1 = torch.cat([dec1, enc1], dim=1)
        dec1 = self.dec1(dec1)
        
        return self.out(dec1)
    
    def training_step(self, batch, batch_idx):
        images, masks = batch
        logits = self(images)
        loss = self.criterion(logits, masks)
        
        self.log('train_loss', loss)
        return loss
    
    def validation_step(self, batch, batch_idx):
        images, masks = batch
        logits = self(images)
        loss = self.criterion(logits, masks)
        
        self.log('val_loss', loss)
        return loss
    
    def configure_optimizers(self):
        return torch.optim.Adam(self.parameters(), lr=1e-4)


class TrainingOrchestrator:
    """
    Orchestrate training of all models
    """
    
    def __init__(self, data_dir: str):
        self.data_dir = data_dir
        
    def prepare_training_data(self):
        """
        Prepare training data from scraped images + labels
        """
        
        # Load image paths and labels
        train_images, train_labels = self._load_dataset('train')
        val_images, val_labels = self._load_dataset('val')
        
        # Define augmentations
        train_transform = A.Compose([
            A.RandomResizedCrop(512, 512, scale=(0.8, 1.0)),
            A.HorizontalFlip(p=0.5),
            A.VerticalFlip(p=0.5),
            A.Rotate(limit=45, p=0.5),
            A.RandomBrightnessContrast(p=0.5),
            A.GaussNoise(p=0.3),
            A.Blur(blur_limit=3, p=0.3),
            A.Normalize(
                mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],
                std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
            ),
            ToTensorV2()
        ])
        
        val_transform = A.Compose([
            A.Resize(512, 512),
            A.Normalize(
                mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406],
                std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225]
            ),
            ToTensorV2()
        ])
        
        # Create datasets
        train_dataset = RoofDamageDataset(train_images, train_labels, train_transform)
        val_dataset = RoofDamageDataset(val_images, val_labels, val_transform)
        
        # Create dataloaders
        train_loader = DataLoader(
            train_dataset,
            batch_size=32,
            shuffle=True,
            num_workers=4,
            pin_memory=True
        )
        
        val_loader = DataLoader(
            val_dataset,
            batch_size=32,
            shuffle=False,
            num_workers=4,
            pin_memory=True
        )
        
        return train_loader, val_loader
    
    def train_classification_model(self):
        """
        Train EfficientNet classifier
        """
        
        train_loader, val_loader = self.prepare_training_data()
        
        model = RoofDamageDetector()
        
        trainer = pl.Trainer(
            max_epochs=100,
            accelerator='auto',
            devices=1,
            callbacks=[
                pl.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint(
                    monitor='val_loss',
                    dirpath='models/checkpoints',
                    filename='roof-classifier-{epoch:02d}-{val_loss:.2f}',
                    save_top_k=3
                ),
                pl.callbacks.EarlyStopping(
                    monitor='val_loss',
                    patience=10
                )
            ]
        )
        
        trainer.fit(model, train_loader, val_loader)
        
        # Save final model
        torch.save(model.state_dict(), 'models/roof_classifier_final.pth')
        
        return model
    
    def train_yolo_detector(self):
        """
        Train YOLOv8 object detector
        """
        
        # Create data.yaml for YOLO
        data_yaml = f"""
path: {self.data_dir}
train: images/train
val: images/val

nc: 9
names: ['no_damage', 'missing_shingles', 'cracks', 'algae_moss', 'rust_corrosion', 'sagging_warping', 'hail_damage', 'water_damage', 'age_deterioration']
"""
        
        with open(f'{self.data_dir}/data.yaml', 'w') as f:
            f.write(data_yaml)
        
        detector = YOLOv8RoofDetector()
        detector.train(
            data_yaml_path=f'{self.data_dir}/data.yaml',
            epochs=100
        )
        
        return detector
    
    def train_segmentation_model(self):
        """
        Train U-Net segmentation model
        """
        
        train_loader, val_loader = self.prepare_training_data()
        
        model = UNetSegmentationModel()
        
        trainer = pl.Trainer(
            max_epochs=100,
            accelerator='auto',
            devices=1
        )
        
        trainer.fit(model, train_loader, val_loader)
        
        torch.save(model.state_dict(), 'models/roof_segmentation_final.pth')
        
        return model

class EnsembleRoofAnalyzer:
    """
    Combine all models for high-confidence predictions
    Statistical certainty through ensemble voting
    """
    
    def __init__(self):
        # Load all models
        self.classifier = self._load_classifier()
        self.detector = YOLOv8RoofDetector('models/roof_yolo_best.pt')
        self.segmentor = self._load_segmentor()
        
        # Preprocessors
        self.preprocessor = AdvancedImagePreprocessor()
        self.transformer = DamageSpecificTransformations()
        
        # Damage classes
        self.damage_classes = [
            'no_damage',
            'missing_shingles',
            'cracks',
            'algae_moss',
            'rust_corrosion',
            'sagging_warping',
            'hail_damage',
            'water_damage',
            'age_deterioration'
        ]
    
    def _load_classifier(self):
        model = RoofDamageDetector()
        model.load_state_dict(torch.load('models/roof_classifier_final.pth'))
        model.eval()
        return model
    
    def _load_segmentor(self):
        model = UNetSegmentationModel()
        model.load_state_dict(torch.load('models/roof_segmentation_final.pth'))
        model.eval()
        return model
    
    async def analyze_roof_complete(
        self,
        image_path: str,
        confidence_threshold: float = 0.7
    ) -> Dict:
        """
        Complete roof analysis with statistical certainty
        """
        
        print(f"Analyzing roof: {image_path}")
        
        # Step 1: Preprocess image (multiple enhanced versions)
        print("Step 1: Preprocessing...")
        enhanced_images = self.preprocessor.preprocess_image(image_path)
        
        # Step 2: Apply damage-specific transformations
        print("Step 2: Applying transformations...")
        transformations = self.transformer.apply_all_transformations(
            enhanced_images['super_res']
        )
        
        # Step 3: Run all models
        print("Step 3: Running ensemble models...")
        
        # Model 1: Classification on enhanced images
        classification_results = []
        for name, img in enhanced_images.items():
            preds = self._run_classifier(img)
            classification_results.append(preds)
        
        # Model 2: Object detection on transformations
